content.text: Jesse McCartney was born in Westchester, New York and grew up in the New York City area.
McCartney identifies himself as a born-again Christian
and grew up going to church. As an adult, McCartney is involved in various humanitarian charities, and he says it was his religious upbringing that inspired him to do so:
We went to church every Sunday. I do think it's my duty to give back.

content.sourceTitle: Jesse McCartney even more prayer bracelets
content.text: It's been reported that McCartney often wears Christian prayer bracelets,
but really, McCartney doesn't really talk about his faith. He does, however, acknowledge religion's influence on his current worldview:
Maybe it's because of my upbringing, but I do consider myself a moral guy.

content.sourceTitle: Jesse McCartney: 'I consider myself a moral guy.'
content.text: This is all pretty mild stuff. My guess is that McCartney is either deliberately quiet about his religious beliefs or he is, in fact, only mildly religious. When it came to the "purity rings" of his contemporaries, The Jonas Brothers, McCartney said he'd never take it that far and that he's "single" and "seeing what's out there."
McCartney is wily when it comes to politics. There is no indication that I can find outlining his views, though some claim he supported Obama in 2012.

content.text: Speaking of American platitudes, McCartney forgot the lyrics to the National Anthem at a NASCAR race.
He was probably just nervous, but I can't imagine it happening anywhere worse than a NASCAR race.
